metadata.Title: CVE-2016-8887 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The jp2_colr_destroy function in libjasper/jp2/jp2_cod.c in JasPer before 1.900.10 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-8887` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libjasper-runtime - 1.900.1-14ubuntu3.5
libjasper1 - 1.900.1-14ubuntu3.5
No subscription required

notes.Note: sbeattie> first fix was incomplete, need second fix as well

criterions.comment: jasper package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.900.1-14ubuntu3.5').
